name: synthetic graphite production, battery grade | synthetic graphite, battery grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25146/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg synthetic graphite in China. Synthetic graphite is used as input material for the production of anode in commercial Lithium-ion batteries. This dataset is a copy of the corresponding regional dataset. Production volume was adjusted.;;Reference:;Dunn, J. B., James, C., Gaines, L., Gallagher, K., Dai, Q., & Kelly, J. C. (2015). Material and energy flows in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries (No. ANL/ESD-14/10 Rev). Argonne National Lab.(ANL), Argonne, IL (United States).

The activity starts with materials entering the system.

The activity ends with the production of 1 kg synthetic graphite, battery grade. Emissions and infrastructure are included in the dataset.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2015 (year of the publication of data) and 2020 (year of the dataset)
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The production of synthetic graphite is assumed to be based in China, leader country in the global production of synthetic graphite in 2017 (USGS, 2017. Minerals Yearbook - Graphite)
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The industrial product process starts with grinding and sizing the petroleum coke, which is then sent to the mixer where it is blended with the coal tar pitch.The mixture coming out of the mixer is cooled from 160-170 째C to around 100째C, and then fed into an extruder for subsequent forming in order to maximize the density of the mixture and shape it into the form and size of the final product. The formed product is heated to 800-1000 째C in a natural gas-fired furnace (carbonization process). In the graphitization furnace, which is exclusively powered by;electricity, the mixture is slowly fired to around 3000 째C for the formation of graphite crystals.;;Reference:;Dunn, J. B., James, C., Gaines, L., Gallagher, K., Dai, Q., & Kelly, J. C. (2015). Material and energy flows in the production of cathode and anode materials for lithium ion batteries (No. ANL/ESD-14/10 Rev). Argonne National Lab.(ANL), Argonne, IL (United States).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The dataset is extrapolated from CN data; the uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.

flow.name: synthetic graphite, battery grade
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

exchanges.description:
Literature Value. 4.5 kWh for graphitization step (Dunn 2015), 0.5 for calcination step (Surovtseva 2022).
Reference:
- Dunn, J. B., James, C., Gaines, L., Kevin, G., Qiang, D., & Kelly, J. C. (2015). Material and Energy Flows in the Production of Cathode and Anode Mateirals for Lithium Ion Batteries. https://www.ptonline.com/articles/how-to-get-better-mfi-results
- Surovtseva, D., Crossin, E., Pell, R., & Stamford, L. (2022). Toward a life cycle inventory for graphite production. Journal of Industrial Ecology, 26(3), 964-979. https://doi.org/10.1111/jiec.13234

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on literature data published by the industry. For this activity, no information was readily available concerning infrastructure and land-use. Therefore, the infrastructure is estimated based on data from two chemical factories, the BASF site of Ludwigshafen and the chemical factory in Gendorf (which are both located in Germany), which produce a wide range of chemical substances. Based on this data, the following assumptions are made: the built area amounts to about 4.2 ha, the plant has an average output of 50'000 t/a and a lifespan of fifty years. The estimated infrastructure amount is therefore 4.00 E-10 units per kg of produced chemical. 
References: 
Althaus H.-J., Chudacoff M., Hischier R., Jungbluth N., Osses M. and Primas A. (2007) Life Cycle Inventories of Chemicals. ecoinvent report No. 8, v2.0. EMPA D체bendorf, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, D체bendorf, CH. 
Gendorf (2000) Umwelterkl채rung 2000, Werk Gendorf. Werk Gendorf, Burgkirchen.om ecoinvent)
